title: Big Leagues
question_text:
Mr. Skonte and Mr. Thurban volunteer as umpires for their local youth baseball programs. Mr. Skonte calls strikes correctly $95.1\%$ of the time ($\hat{p}_S=0.951$), while Mr. Thurban calls strikes correctly $96.9\%$ of the time ($\hat{p}_T=0.969$). Because they love to game so much, and are good at what they do, Mr. Skonte and Mr. Thurban plan to apply to be professional umpires.
A scout decides to watch each of them umpire a random selection of pitches and compute the difference in the proportion of correctly called strikes.
$100$ pitches for each umpire
$200$ pitches for each umpire
$300$ pitches for each umpire
Under which of the above circumstances would the sampling distribution of the difference of correctly called strikes be approximately Normal?

choices.text: None of the scenarios are sufficient to assume an approximately Normal sampling distribution in the difference in proportion of correctly called strikes.
